instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.BLK_EN: What is BLK_EN? This is a typo of BKL_EN When you see BLK_EN, assume they meant to type BKL_EN.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
Hello, I have searched the forum for other messages but I have not seen anything similar to my problem.

The equipment turns on and after a second the backlight does not work. With a PRAM reset now the device keeps the backlight until almost the end of the block and it disappears, it gets to the user screen and it still doesn't work. I have done several PRAM resets and I have tried another screen but the same problem..

any ideas? thanks !

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
Any history available?
Check <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM when the problem appears.
What is backlight output voltage behavior?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
history anything  never any problem

<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>=2,80v
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>=1,44v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
Test starting in safe and also SMC bypass mode.

Backlight always present if keep the machine in boot menu?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
It doesn't work in safe mode at any time. And I have tried three pram resets and neither. 

Before at least it worked a few seconds after the pram...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and run wire from <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>.
Confirm if you get full backlight; no adjust possible.
Then do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
Remove the wire and put back <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR>; still working?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A backlight dont work
threads.message: hello again, I remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and run wire from <CAPACITOR>C7711</CAPACITOR> (point 1 <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>) to <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> (point 2 <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL>) but I don't get full backlight, too I try 3 times pram reset

Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.message: You can check backlight output voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7797</CAPACITOR>/99, or pins 3/4 of J8300.

all points <CAPACITOR>C7797</CAPACITOR>/97 and J8300 = 8,50v solid
